stanfordlogic.game
Class GameManager

java.lang.Object
  stanfordlogic.game.GameManager

public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object

The Game Manager encapsulates the global program state.

newGame

public static Gamer newGame(java.lang.String gameId,
                            GdlAtom role,
                            GdlList description,
                            int startClock,
                            int playClock)
Starts a new game. Takes the information from the start message and gives it to the gamer factory, which creates an appropriate gamer for the game.

Parameters:
gameId - The identifier of the game being started.
role - The role I am playing in the new game.
description - The description (rules) of the game.
startClock - The time given to think about the game.
playClock - The time given to make a move.
Returns:
The Gamer instance created to play the game.
See Also:
Gamer

endGame

public static void endGame(java.lang.String gameId,
                           GdlList prevMoves)
Ends the game specified by gameId. The final moves are processed and the payoffs are computed and printed to the logger.

Parameters:
gameId - Name of the game to terminate.
prevMoves - The last set of moves made in the game.

getGame

public static Gamer getGame(java.lang.String gameId)
Get the Gamer associated with gameId.

Parameters:
gameId - The name of the gamer to get.
Returns:
The Gamer object associated with gameId.

Gamer
